title: Single GC base pair recognition by a heterocyclic diamidine: structures, affinities, and dynamics
content:
RSC Adv., 2024, 14,29675-29682
DOI: 10.1039/D4RA05957C, Paper
Open Access
Â  This article is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial 3.0 Unported Licence.
Edwin N. Ogbonna, J Ross Terrell, Ananya Paul, Abdelbasset A. Farahat, Gregory M. K. Poon, David W. Boykin, W. David Wilson
The heterocylic diamidine DB2447 recognizes a single GC base pair in the minor groove of a mixed DNA sequence. The DNA is stabilized by a PU.1 protein bound to the major groove.
